text: Ditrigona innotata is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by George Hampson in 1892. It is found in China. The wingspan is 18 mm for males and 17.5-19.5 mm for females. The forewings and hindwings are uniform white with a few scales., 1968: A taxonomic revision of the genus Ditrigona (Lepidoptera: Drepanidae: Drepaninae). The Transactions of the Zoological Society of London Volume 31, Issue 4; Abstract: A taxonomic revision of the genus Ditrigona (Lepidoptera: Drepanidae: Drepaninae) ==References== Category:Moths described in 1892 Category:Drepaninae Category:Moths of China
title: Ditrigona innotata
